name: since
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: Emma went to work in New York a year ago, and we haven't seen her since.
example.egtrans: 埃玛一年前去纽约工作了，自那时起我们就没有见过她。

example.eg: He started working for the company in 1995, and has been there ever since (= and is still there).
example.egtrans: 他1995年就开始为那家公司工作，在此之后就一直在那里。

example.eg: I've long since (= long ago) forgotten any Latin I ever learned.
example.egtrans: 我早就把我学过的那点拉丁语忘光了。

name: since
posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: He hasn't won a game since last year.
example.egtrans: 他自去年起就再没有赢过比赛。

example.eg: It was the hottest October since records began.
example.egtrans: 这是有史以来最热的十月。

name: since
posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

dsense.name: since
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

example.eg: Since we've got a few minutes to wait for the train, let's have a cup of coffee.
example.egtrans: 既然等火车还需要几分钟，我们去喝杯咖啡吧。

dsense.name: since
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: I've been very busy since I came back from holiday.
example.egtrans: 我度完假回来后就一直很忙。
